item.title: Karla add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Karla add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Karla add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Karla add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Karla add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Karla add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Karla add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We are an impossibility in an impossible universe." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Karla add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Why is it," he said, one time, at the subway entrance, "I feel I've known you so many years?" "Because I like you," she said, "and I don't want anything from you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Karla add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "There's no use going to school unless your final destination is the library." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Karla add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Karla add a quote by Wisława Szymborska
item.description:
"When I pronounce the word Future, the first syllable already belongs to the past.
When I pronounce the word Silence, I destroy it." -- Wisława Szymborska

item.title: Karla add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Always try to keep a patch of sky above your life." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Karla add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "They slipped briskly into an intimacy from which they never recovered." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Karla add a quote by Brian Selznick
item.description: "Ben wished the world was organized by the Dewey decimal system. That way you'd be able to find whatever you were looking for." -- Brian Selznick

item.title: Karla add a quote by Jean Kerr
item.description: "I make mistakes; I'll be the second to admit it." -- Jean Kerr

item.title: Karla add a quote by Anne Herbert
item.description: "Libraries will get you through times of no money better than money will get you through times of no libraries." -- Anne Herbert

item.title: Karla add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Karla add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help." -- Bill Watterson
